Hey there, I‚Äôm Vish! üòÄ
I am a master‚Äôs student at Carnegie Mellon University‚Äôs Language Technologies Institute (LTI) specializing in Machine Learning (ML) and Natural Language Processing (NLP).
I‚Äôm broadly interested in exploring the abilities that emerge out of language-grounded exploration in interactive settings. This could either be commonsense reasoning üß† , programming üíª , or decison-making/agentic behaviour ü§ñ
I‚Äôm currently working on Code Generation üíª, and improving efficiency of generated code in an interactive setting, advised by Daniel Fried.
During my undergrad years at PES University, Indian Institute of Science and Intel, I worked on projects in various domains of ML from Natural Language Processing, Reinforcement Learning, Graph ML, Continual Learning and Computer Vision.
Checkout my üìÉ Publications here!

title: Vishruth Veerendranath
text:
News

December 2023: Attended NeurIPS 2023 and presented ScripTONES at the MLForAudio workshop!
October 2023: ScripTONES presented at AIMLSystems-GenAI and accepeted as a poster at the MLForAudio @ NeurIPS 2023!
September 2023: Started working with Daniel Fried, Zora Wang and Siddhanth Waghjale on Efficient Code Generation!
August 2023: Moved to Pittsburgh and joined the MIIS program at CMU!
July 2023: Work at Intel presented at ICML 2023 workshops on PAC-Bayes meets Interactive Learning
June 2023: Work at IISc up on arXiv PMP-DRL
